metadata.description: Allows you to perform apt-get functions
Executes an arbitrary shell command on the target system

command.description: The command to run, including all arguments

interleave.description: Interleave the stdout and stderr streams.(default: true)

failonfail.description: Should the task fail if the command exits nonzero.(default: true)

metadata.description: Make a HTTP or HTTPS request.

base_url.description: The fully qualified URL scheme to make requests to.

body.description: The request body. If json_endpoint is true, must be able representable as JSON. If json_endpoint is false, must be a string.

cacert.description: An absolute path to the CA certificate.

cert.description: An absolute path to the client certificate.

headers.description: A map of headers to add to the payload.

json_endpoint.description: If true, parses the request and response bodies as JSON and sets the Content-Type header to application/json.

key.description: An absolute path to the RSA keypair.

max_redirects.description: The maximum number of redirects to follow when follow_redirects is true.

path.description: The path to append to the base_url.

metadata.description: Ensures settings on a logical volume using the type & provider

name.description: The name of the logical volume.  This is the unqualified name and will be automatically added to the volume group's device path (e.g., '/dev/$vg/$lv').

volume_group.description: The volume group name associated with this logical volume

size.description: The size of the logical volume. Set to undef to use all available space

extents.description: The number of logical extents to allocate for the new logical volume. Set to undef to use all available space

persistent.description: Set to true to make the block device persistent

thinpool.description: Set to true to create a thin pool or to pool name to create thin volume

poolmetadatasize.description: Change the size of logical volume pool metadata

range.description: Sets the inter-physical volume allocation policy. AIX only

stripes.description: The number of stripes to allocate for the new logical volume

stripesize.description: The stripesize to use for the new logical volume

readahead.description: The readahead count to use for the new logical volume

resize_fs.description: Whether or not to resize the underlying filesystem when resizing the logical volume

mirror.description: The number of mirrors of the volume

mirrorlog.description: How to store the mirror log

alloc.description: Selects the allocation policy when a command needs to allocate Physical Extents from the Volume Group

no_sync.description: An optimization in lvcreate, at least on Linux

region_size.description: A mirror is divided into regions of this size (in MB), the mirror log uses this granularity to track which regions are in sync. CAN NOT BE CHANGED on already mirrored volume. Take your mirror size in terabytes and round up that number to the next power of 2, using that number as the -R argument.

metadata.description: Ensures settings on a physical volumes using the type & provider

name.description: The name of the physical volume

unless_vg.description: Do not do anything if the VG already exists.  The value should be the name of the volume group to check for.

force.description: Force the creation without any confirmation

metadata.description: Ensures settings on a volume group using the type & provider

name.description: The name of the volume group

createonly.description: If set to true the volume group will be created if it does not exist. If the volume group does exist no action will be taken

followsymlinks.description: If set to true all current and wanted values of the physical_volumes property will be followed to their real files on disk if they are in fact symlinks. This is useful to have Puppet determine what the actual PV device is if the property value is a symlink, like '/dev/disk/by-path/xxxx -> ../../sda'

physical_volumes.description: The list of physical volumes to be included in the volume group

logical_volume.description: Name of the logical volume to extend

volume_group.description: Name of the volume group on which the logical volume resides

metadata.description: Adds physical volumes to a volume group

volume_group.description: The name of the volume group

physical_volumes.description: The list of physical volumes to be included in the volume group

volume_group.description: The name of the volume group

logical_volume.description: The name of the logical_volume to mount

mountpoint.description: Where to mount the logical volume

fstype.description: The mount type. Valid values depend on the operating system. This is a required option.

options.description: A single string containing options for the mount, as they would appear in fstab on Linux. For many platforms this is a comma-delimited string

atboot.description: Whether to mount the mount at boot. Not all platforms support this.

metadata.description: Manage and inspect the state of packages

action.description: The operation (install, status, uninstall and upgrade) to perform on the package.

name.description: The name of the package to be manipulated.

version.description: Version numbers must match the full version to install, including release if the provider uses a release moniker. Ranges or semver patterns are not accepted except for the gem package provider. For example, to install the bash package from the rpm bash-4.1.2-29.el6.x86_64.rpm, use the string '4.1.2-29.el6'.

manager_options.description: options to be sent to the package manager

provider.description: The provider to use to manage or inspect the package, defaults to the system package manager. Only used when the 'puppet-agent' feature is available on the target so we can leverage Puppet.

force.description: Whether to overwrite an existing key pair

keysize.description: The size of the key to generate

metadata.description: Run the Puppet agent facts diff action

exclude.description: Regex used to exclude specific facts from diff

version.description: The version of puppet-agent to install (defaults to latest when no agent is installed)

collection.description: The Puppet collection to install from (defaults to puppet, which maps to the latest collection released)
collection.type: Optional[Enum[puppet6, puppet7, puppet, puppet6-nightly, puppet7-nightly, puppet-nightly]]

yum_source.description: The source location to find yum repos (defaults to yum.puppet.com)

apt_source.description: The source location to find apt repos (defaults to apt.puppet.com)

mac_source.description: The source location to find mac packages (defaults to downloads.puppet.com)

windows_source.description: The source location to find windows packages (defaults to downloads.puppet.com)

install_options.description: optional install arguments to the windows installer (defaults to REINSTALLMODE="amus")

stop_service.description: Whether to stop the puppet agent service after install

retry.description: The number of retries in case of network connectivity failures

metadata.description: Get the version of the Puppet agent package installed. Returns nothing if none present.

action.description: The operation (get, set, delete) to perform on the configuration setting

section.description: The section of the config file. Defaults to main

setting.description: The name of the config entry to set/get

value.description: The value you are setting. Only required for set

timeout.description: Timeout before shutdown (seconds); enforces a minimum of 3s

message.description: Shutdown message for systems that support it

shutdown_only.description: Only shut the machine down, do not reboot

metadata.description: Gets the last boot time of a Linux or Windows system
Manage and inspect the state of services

action.description: The operation (start, stop, restart, enable, disable, status) to perform on the service.
action.type: Enum[start, stop, restart, enable, disable, status]

name.description: The name of the service to operate on.

force.description: Force a Windows service to restart even if it has dependent services. This parameter is passed for Windows services only.

provider.description: The provider to use to manage or inspect the service, defaults to the system service manager. Only used when the 'puppet-agent' feature is available on the target so we can leverage Puppet.

dir.description: Path to Terraform project directory. Path is relative to CWD, unless an absolute path is specified.

state.description: Path to read and save state. Defaults to "terraform.tfstate". Path is relative to "dir"

target.description: Resource to target. Operation will be limited to this resource and its dependencies. Accepts a single resource string or an array of resources

var.description: Set Terraform variables, expects a hash with key value pairs representing variables and values.

var_file.description: Set variables in the Terraform configuration from a file. Path is relative to "dir". Accepts a single var-file path or an array of paths

state_out.description: Path to write state to that is different than "state". This can be used to preserve the old state.

dir.description: Path to Terraform project directory. Path is relative to CWD, unless an absolute path is specified.

state.description: Path to read and save state. Defaults to "terraform.tfstate", Path is relative to "dir"

target.description: Resource to target. Operation will be limited to this resource and its dependencies. Accepts a single resource string or an array of resources

var.description: Set Terraform variables, expects a hash with key value pairs representing variables and values.

var_file.description: Set variables in the Terraform configuration from a file. Path is relative to "dir". Accepts a single var-file path or an array of paths

state_out.description: Path to write state to that is different than "state". This can be used to preserve the old state.

dir.description: Path to Terraform project directory. Path is relative to CWD, unless an absolute path is specified.
Path to Terraform project directory. Path is relative to CWD, unless an absolute path is specified.

state.description: Path to read and save state. Defaults to "terraform.tfstate", Path is relative to "dir"
